verses.roman:
rāya kahe,--"rūpera kāvya amṛtera pūra
tāra madhye eka bindu diyāche karpūra"

synonyms: rāya kahe—Śrīla Rāmānanda Rāya says; rūpera kāvya—the poetic expression of Śrīla Rūpa Gosvāmī; amṛtera pūra—filled with all nectar; tāra madhye—within that; eka bindu—one drop; diyāche—he has given; karpūra—camphor.
translation: Śrīla Rāmānanda Rāya objected, "It is not alkali at all. It is a particle of camphor he has put into the nectar of his exalted poetic expression."
